alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 15 at 4:07AM MDT until June 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EAST-CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An upper level trough approaching from the west will spread stronger west southwest winds over much of central and eastern New Mexico this afternoon. The combination of rising temperatures, very low humidity, strong winds, and an unstable airmass will produce critical fire weather conditions. Single-digit humidities will last 6 to 12 hours for portions of the Middle Rio Grande Valley. Another round of strong winds is expected to develop Friday afternoon ahead of an additional upper level disturbance. This will create the potential for additional critical fire weather, as dry and unstable conditions will persist on Friday. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from Friday afternoon through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West and southwest at 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 6 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
